visitors_to_korea.ranking: 4th largest source country (after Japan, China, US)

spending.medical_share_of_total: 46.5% of total spending is medical (remainder is shopping, dining, tourism)

medical_tourism.interest_rate: Very high and rapidly accelerating; Taiwan is Korea's fastest-growing medical tourism source market by percentage growth

medical_tourism.avg_spending_per_patient: ~6.98 million KRW (~$5,070 USD) per patient (calculated: 579B KRW / 83,000 patients)
medical_tourism.cost_advantage: Korea is 30-50% cheaper than Taiwan for most dermatology procedures; 40-70% cheaper than Western countries

flight_info.routes: Taipei (TPE) <-> Seoul (ICN/GMP); also Kaohsiung <-> Busan, Kaohsiung <-> Jeju

18-24.priority: K-beauty products, basic skin treatments, acne care

25-34.priority: Preventive anti-aging, skin brightening, pore care, Rejuran

45+.priority: Advanced anti-aging, lifting, skin tightening, stem cell therapies

demographics.gender: Predominantly female (estimated 75-80%); male aesthetic treatments growing, especially among younger demographics
demographics.hallyu_influence: Very strong. Taiwan represents 9.2% of overseas attendees at major K-Pop events. K-dramas drive direct tourism (e.g., Netflix drama success reopened Kaohsiung-Jeju direct flights). 82% of core Hallyu fans shop for K-Beauty items during Korea visits. K-beauty imports have surged with Olive Young Global Mall actively targeting Taiwanese consumers.

price_comparison.note: Korea is generally 30-50% cheaper than Taiwan for dermatology procedures, and 40-70% cheaper than Western countries. Taiwan itself is already 30-70% cheaper than the US.

examples.savings: Korea 30-50% cheaper (especially with Korean brands like Wondertox/Nabota)

examples.taiwan: Not widely available domestically; Korean clinics have a technology/availability advantage

additional_cost_factors.consultation_fee_korea: $50-150 USD (some clinics waive if treatment booked)

trends_2026: Cellular regeneration focus: stem cell and exosome-based treatments gaining mainstream adoption
Combination protocols: Thermage FLX + Rejuran Healer or LaseMD + Exosome Therapy in single visits
Natural aesthetic (自然美): preference for subtle enhancements over dramatic changes
Short-stay medical tourism: 3-day trip optimized for treatment + recovery + shopping
Korean-brand injectables: growing acceptance of Korean-manufactured Botox alternatives (Nabota, Wondertox) at 50-80% lower cost
Technology-first approach: Taiwanese consumers value cutting-edge devices (PicoSure, Thermage FLX) over traditional methods
Glass skin trend (水光肌): continued demand for hydration-focused treatments (water-glow injection, Aqua Peeling)
Male aesthetics growth: increasing number of Taiwanese men seeking dermatology treatments in Korea
Busan emerging: direct Kaohsiung-Busan flights making southern Korea accessible for Taiwanese tourists
Post-Xiaohongshu shift: with Xiaohongshu blocked in Taiwan (Dec 2025), discovery shifting to Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and Dcard

language_considerations.primary_language: Traditional Chinese (繁體中文/正體中文)

platform_language_mapping.instagram: Traditional Chinese captions; hashtags in both Chinese and Korean
platform_language_mapping.youtube: Traditional Chinese titles, descriptions, and subtitles; Mandarin Chinese voiceover
platform_language_mapping.line: Traditional Chinese; primary communication channel (22M monthly active users, 94% penetration)
platform_language_mapping.ptt: Traditional Chinese only; Taiwan's largest forum
platform_language_mapping.google: Traditional Chinese search queries; often searching '韓國皮膚科' '韓國醫美推薦'
platform_language_mapping.clinic_materials: Must be in Traditional Chinese; some clinics mistakenly use Simplified Chinese which alienates Taiwanese consumers

content_strategy_notes.critical_distinction: Always use Traditional Chinese (繁體中文), never Simplified Chinese (简体中文). Taiwanese consumers are sensitive to this distinction.
content_strategy_notes.korean_terms: Include romanized Korean alongside Chinese translations (e.g., 'Rejuran嬰兒針', '皮秒雷射Pico Laser')
content_strategy_notes.tone: Professional but approachable; avoid overly clinical language. Taiwanese consumers prefer detailed, informative content with real pricing.
content_strategy_notes.line_strategy: LINE is the #1 communication platform in Taiwan. All clinics must have LINE official accounts with Traditional Chinese support for consultation and booking.

domestic_market_characteristics: Advanced and mature aesthetic medicine market with FDA-approved technologies
Strong domestic clinic infrastructure (PicoSure, Thermage FLX, Ultherapy, Emsculpt Neo available)
Prices already lower than US/Europe but higher than Korea for most procedures
Social media influence driving younger consumer adoption
Medical spas and beauty clinics segment expanding rapidly
why_still_go_to_korea: Korea offers 30-50% lower prices for equivalent treatments
Access to Korea-exclusive treatments (Rejuran, Korean-brand injectables) not widely available in Taiwan
Perceived higher expertise in dermatology due to Korea's global reputation
Can combine with K-beauty shopping, K-pop/drama tourism
Volume and competition in Korean clinics drives innovation and service quality
Social currency: visiting Korean clinics is a status/trend marker

primary_methods: International credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, JCB widely accepted at Korean clinics)
Cash (Korean Won; recommended to carry some for smaller clinics)
LINE Pay (Taiwanese LINE Pay accepted at Shilla Duty Free and select merchants since July 2024)
TWQR (BC Card QR system enabling Taiwanese mobile payments at Korean merchants since Jan 2024)
payment_methods.recommended_strategy: Credit card + small cash combination is most reliable for short-term medical tourism
notes: Most major Korean dermatology clinics accept international credit cards
JCB cards have especially good acceptance in Korean tourist areas
LINE Pay cross-border payment expanding but still limited to select merchants
Some smaller clinics may prefer cash payment
Currency exchange available at Incheon Airport and Myeongdong money changers

korea_vs_alternatives.japan: More expensive than Korea; Taiwanese prefer Korea for dermatology, Japan for general healthcare
korea_vs_alternatives.thailand: Cheaper but perceived as lower quality for dermatology; Korea has stronger brand cachet
korea_vs_alternatives.taiwan_domestic: Convenient but more expensive; lacks Korea-exclusive treatments and K-beauty ecosystem
korea_vs_alternatives.china: Not considered for medical aesthetics by Taiwanese consumers due to political/trust factors

korea_strengths_for_taiwan_market: Price advantage over Taiwan domestic market
Technology and innovation leadership in dermatology
Growing Chinese-language support infrastructure at clinics
Visa-free entry for Taiwanese citizens (90 days)
